results.title: [Cattle breeding in UK]
results.brief_description: Showing off bulls of various cattle in UK. These animals are specifically bred to withstand extreme climatic conditions and to fend for themselves either in UK or other countries like South America. Breeds shown include: Herefords Devon, Aberdeen Angus and Shorthorns. The Shorthorns are bred for beef and milk. Short snippet of King George, Queen Elizabeth and the two princesses at a cattle show.

results.title: [By Jupiter]
results.creator_credit: Jack Tilles and Wilding Picture Productions
results.brief_description: The film approaches the universal problem of improving the attitude of man to man. Shows how the attitude of a person reacts upon the people whom he meets in his way to work - first, when he is angry and, secondly, when he uses consideration to accomplish his ends.

results.title: [Automatic profiling machine]
results.brief_description: A documentary on the Profiling Machine, including all technical aspects as well as how the machine works with different tools. (Basically the machine is used for cutting down wood to different sizes.)

results.brief_description: A demonstration and explanation of the reconditioning (both automatic and manual) of wheel sets of trains developed by the German Federal Railways.

results.title: [A Design for leisure]
results.creator_credit: Richard Graham and Australia. Dept. of Tourism
results.brief_description: Melbourne architect, Mr Jack Clarke, discusses the need for recreation facilities to be done so that not only will the centre provide the recreation activities required by the community but it would attract all sections of the community. Focuses on architectural style and design.

results.title: 'Servent' solves a problem
results.creator_credit: Ivor P. Kershaw and Factual Films of Australia
results.brief_description: A demonstration of how a newly-developed system of wiring between your house and the main electricity supply may be used to eliminate unsightly masses of wires between your home and the poles in the street. (Sponsored by Olympic Cables.)

results.title: 'Justice' of the Red functionaries
results.brief_description: Inspired and colourful narration accompanies this montage of German propaganda designed to illustrate the worst tyrannies of a Soviet State. Shows the administration of justice in 1948 as applied under Ulbricht’s communist regime. Includes pictures taken in Soviet zonal courts, and interviews with judges who fled to the West. An example of cold-war era red-scare demagoguery.

results.title: Cookery Nook [advertisement]
results.creator_credit: Australian Dried Fruits Association and Australian Sound Films
results.brief_description: A surreal slice of life from the 1930s, this advertisement was possibly the second sound cartoon ever made in Australia (an advertisement for Shell Oil, Percy Perplexed, being the first). Both films were made by the same production house, Melbourne’s Australian Sound Films, and animator, Dick Ovenden. His work as an illustrator was well known to Australians through his work in newspapers and magazines. Both Percy Perplexed and Cookery Nook were produced at a time when sound films were changing the face of cinema. ‘Cookery Nook’ may have been screened in the Dried Fruits van that toured the country promoting dried fruits to community and mothers’ groups. In a newspaper article from the same year, JM Balfour, Chair of the publicity committee, emphasised ‘the desirability, both in the interests of health and for the sake of hundreds of growers, that more raisins and sultanas should be used in Australia” (see also: The Sydney Morning Herald, 8 July 1931). [Source: Beth Taylor and Sally Jackson.]
results.creator_credit_for_label: Australian Dried Fruits Association and Australian Sound Films

results.title: Australian Designers show their talents [excerpt from Australian Diary No. 007]
results.creator_credit: Jack S. Allan and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description:
We take a look back at some Australian designs from 1947. Woollen suits, sporty tennis outfits, debutantes gowns, plastic high-heeled shoes! hats and bridal wear are all paraded in this high-end extravaganza of Australian style.
Source: NFSA Film Australia Collection

results.title: Collected Cartoons of the Moment by Harry Julius [NFSA Compilation]
results.brief_description: Harry Julius was employed to produce sketches supporting the conscription drive in Australia for wartime editions of the Australasian Gazette newsreel. He was the first artist in Australia to animate cartoons for films. He successfully used caricature and satire to comment on the social, political and economic impact of World War One – from the Allies point of view. Julius’s drawn animation regularly includes the appearance of animals representing the major war countries including: a battered fez-capped turkey (Turkey); a large aggressive eagle (the United States); and a Union Jack-covered bulldog or lion (the United Kingdom).
